posts.author: CriticalElf
posts.content:
I've been thinking about Rules lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about Rules that came up in our game last night.

The rules for Rules seem a bit ambiguous to me. On page 123 it states one thing, but then on page 145 it seems to contradict that. How do you interpret this?

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about Rules?

posts.author: DungeonMasterDave
posts.content:
The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of clarification: to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use clarification: to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

In our last session, we encountered a Basilisk and tried to use clarification: to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

posts.author: FighterFanatic
posts.content:
Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that concentration functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how concentration works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

For my next character, I want to focus on concentration as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

In my campaign, we had a situation with concentration that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
